comment: Nice but still need more improvement  :)

title: Just Too Perfect.
comment: It does EXACTLY what I want it to do: allows me to create a basic list of things. No flashy features, just the list title and the items therein. For whatever reason, there are virtually no other apps that allow to do this without unnecessarily clunky additives. Not everyone is out to buy grocery, after all.

title: Nice but seems to have a bug.
comment: I am running Android 4.4.2 on a Samsung SM-T705. The dark theme works ok, but the light theme seems to have an error when an item is marked as done. This causes the entire line to disappear as the crossed out text seems to be highlighted in white so it merges with the background. You can only see what is on the line when you select it as this highlights it in blue temporarily. Hope it can be fixed as it's a nicely designed app otherwise. Thanks.
Awesome

title: Can be improved
comment: Can not reorganise items. No option to send crossed subjects to bottom.   Crossing items should not be buried in a menu.

title: Is a great app
comment: But now I just got a new phone. And I have a large to do list on the old phone. How can I send all my information?. Help please.

title: Great for task lists... But...
comment: Like another user said: needs ability to reorder added tasks. Also needs ability to group select tasks.
Beautiful simplicity! Would need a more worthy logo/app icon though...  :(

title: Minimalist Done Right But...
comment: This app is great with its simplicity, and I like how highlighting an item allows it to stick out so much that the app can be used as a hierarchical list maker, but it's missing one crucial feature for 5 stars: list reorganizing. As of right now, I can't seem to find a way to recorder my items besides deleting the adjacent items, and it's very frustrating. Please add in reorganizing and we're 5-stars golden!

title: No need 4 more
comment: Easy, clean, elegant. No permissions.

title: Great for people who need task lists on phone.
comment: Visual appeal is great, users can create sets of tasks. But the interface itself may need a mile overhaul, to include a few preset fields for tasks, like time or date planned for the task and option to mark as done or half-completed.

title: Note 2 ...love it
comment: This is a nice app, make my lists and have the ability to check off , mark done, edit or delete and still see the item.

title: Incomplete
comment: Feels like a good idea abruptly terminated

Hi Tomislav,

Do you mean that there are features you want to see that is not yet available? I'd love to hear more about what you think is missing. I'm still hard at work to continue updating the app :).

title: Not too bad, but could use some tweaks...
comment: Not a bad app, but a few "downers"... 1 - doesn't let you reorder lists; doesn't let you reorder items w/in lists (order entered is order they stay in) 2 - doesn't allow for different categories 3 - list title box allows me to use T9, but list item box does not allow T9 (using Smart Keyboard Trial)...what's up with that?

title: It doesn't show anything on my phone!!!
comment: All I can do is edit a Focus in the blue window and add lists. On the list window, there is nothing. Just pitch black screen with no function at all, not like the screenshot here. I don't know why it isn't showing anything?

Thanks for letting me know Irene!

I've tried to narrow down the problem and it seems this happens when the Android version is lower than 4.1. An update is coming to fix the black screen issues, but the app will now require 4.1 as the minimum phone version.

title: Perfect
comment: Does exactly what it says. Clean interface. No ads. Perfect for making lists.  The best part is there is no additional stuff. Just what I wanted.

title: No Need To Look Anywhere Else
comment: There is no better hierarchical app available for an Android phone. This app has everything and it gives it to you all for free! No ads, no permissions no cost - it has every feature you can ask for without any hassles or problems. The app works smoothly with no problems and with no force closures or any of the other concerns that often come up with free apps. Dev is responsive and is continually updating a fantastic app. 'Nuff Said

title: "Focus"
comment: Is completely pointless.   The source code is clean, and the app is clean. Thanks!

title: Not very good!
comment: You can't type on actual note page, only in a tiny text box, sucks!

title: Good concept
comment: Like idea of starting with a focus and creating a list or several lists related to that focus. Especially in a clean interface like this. But.. Can create focus names and list names, but no way to actually add items to the list?? Focus names do not show up after adding them. Thought of using list names as a list as a workaround but cannot sort them under the focus. So not ready for release.

title: Really
comment: Nice

title: Error
comment: I like the appearance of this app. But in my xperia miro, error. Can't write any list, except the title. Blank screen. Please, check this.

title: Didn't work
comment: Focus useless, wouldn't let me list items in the lists, so entirely useless.

Hi Laura,

Could you email me at jeffrey.mtn@gmail.com with the problems you're having? I'll see what I can do to fix the issues you're having in an upcoming update.

Thanks!

title: Beautiful
comment: Reminder and recurring tasks features can make it a great Google tasks alternative. Focus wasn't really necessary.

title: The first 5 star I've given in 4 years
comment: The first 5 star I've given in 4 years to an android app

title: Very good
comment: Very nice and simplistic notes app.

title: Really nice UI
comment: Suggestions: Selecting multiple list items, drag and drop, etc. Would be great additions

title: Nice Work
comment: Easy, Simple & Clear Keep working :) Waiting for additional features

title: Perfect task list creator
comment: Light and simple but gets the job done.  Can't wait for additional features that will be added.

title: Great app
comment: I love the simplicity of this notes app. It is clearly a work-in-progress, and I can't wait to see what you'll do with it.
